intro: Loncomelos shelkovnikovii, commonly known as the Shelkovnikov's sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
